text.text:
The City of Lake Oswego Municipal Golf Course is currently undergoing a renovation project with expected completion date in late 2024. The municipal project, which was approved and funder with the 2019 Lake Oswego Bond Measure, includes the construction of a new maintenance grounds facility, updated driving range, and rebuild of the existing 18-hole Par 3 course to a full 9-hole executive course designed by Dan Hixson.

The new maintenance facility is being rebuilt on the north side of the golf course adjacent to Stafford Road. Part of the maintenanace upgrade is a new irrigation system. Total cost of the renovation project is estimated to be $12 million and is overseen by the City's Parks and Recreation Department.

Brian Henninger from the PGA Tour is helping with the renovation project serving as a consultant to the project providing input on the design of the new course. Henninger is familiar with the Lake Oswego course:

Milroy Golf Systems is the golf course construction awarded the contract to rebuild the course. Milroy is a specialist golf construction and irrigation contractor based in Newberg, Oregon. The company was founded in 1997 by James Milroy. Milroy Golf Systems specializes in the construction/renovation of golf courses. Some of the projects that Milroy Golf Systems has completed include Meridian Valley Country Club in Washington, the irrigation system at the Bandon Dunes Golf Resort in Oregon. Milroy Golf Systems is a member of Golf Course Builders Association of America, GCBAA.
